main event: An unidentified flying object was reported near Palm Beach, Florida on July 23, 1952, by multiple witnesses, including military personnel.
interesting points: The object was a bright light, half the size of the full moon, observed at an altitude of 2,000 feet., Witnesses noted that the object made an abrupt turn to the south before disappearing from view., The sighting was supported by multiple written statements from four observers, as well as a pilot nearby., The weather conditions were clear with excellent visibility at the time of the sighting., Project Blue Book was unable to identify the object as any known aircraft or natural phenomenon, classifying it as 'UNIDENTIFIED'.
witness description: four observers, including a military pilot
